thread.title: Liverpool target Timo Werner makes Germany debut against England after fine season with RB Leipzig
thread.title_full: Liverpool target Timo Werner makes Germany debut against England after fine season with RB Leipzig

author: Liam Prenderville
title: Liverpool target Timo Werner makes Germany debut against England after fine season with RB Leipzig
text:
Liverpool target Timo Werner makes Germany debut against England after fine season with RB Leipzig The 21-year-old has attracted interest from Jurgen Klopp having scored 14 times in the Bundesliga this season Share Timo Werner smiles during training (Photo: Bongarts) Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Timo Werner has been handed his first Germany start against England. 
The 21-year-old striker has had a fine season with RB Leipzig, scoring 14 times in the Bundesliga, after arriving from Stuttgart just last summer. 
His form has attracted interest from Liverpool with Jurgen Klopp tipped to make a move when the transfer window reopens. 
Werner has previously said he is happy with Leipzig but the clash against the Three Lions gives him an opportunity to impress. 
The striker is set to start alongside Lukas Podolski in attack in Dortmund, as the former Arsenal striker makes his Germany farewell. Timo Werner celebrates scoring (Photo: AFP/Getty) Timo Werner during Germany training (Photo: AFP) Read More 
Former Reds striker Michael Owen has admitted he hopes to see the youngster impress against England. 
"I am interested in seeing Leipzigâ€™s exciting young talent Timo Werner in action," he said. 
"The player has been strongly linked with Liverpool in recent weeks and is in line to win his first international cap." 
Manchester City's Leroy Sane also starts for Joachim Low's side. poll loading Will Timo Werner be at Liverpool next season? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
